answers.answer: Hello twoweelz5,The current symptoms relate to the neuropathy which is most likely due to the compression of the nerves as they emerge out of the spinal cord.I suggest taking a second opinion from the neurologist and discussing for the start of Gabapentin or Lyrica for the management of pain.Best

question: I am a 38 year old male.  I recently, approximately two and a half months ago, strained my middle and lower back.  i saw my doctor, who prescribed methyl prednisolone.  I took it and had no relief.  i returned to the doctor and was prescribed naproxen 500mg twice a day and skelaxin 3 times a day I was also given tramadol for the pain.  I had to stop taking the tramadol due to nausea.  The doctor gave me a shot of toradol in the office to help with the spasms I was having in my middle back.  I again returned to the doctor because about two weeks after the initial injury, began to have numbness in my left foot and left hand.  The doctor sent me to have MRI's of my cervical, thorasic, and lumbosacral spine.  I made an appointment with a neurosurgeon due to the numbness progressing and worsening.  I have numbness in the left foot radiating up the leg and left hand radiating up the arm.  About a month ago my right foot started getting numb and my right hand also, but not to the extreme of the left side.  The neurosurgeon said I have a herniated disc in my neck and middle back, a bulging disc in my lower back.  He does not feel surgery is in order and wants me to get a brain MRI, an ENG test and a blood test to rule out diabetes.  He also can not explain my numbness pattern. My MRI's of the neck and back are not causing the numbness in his opinion.  I am in a lot of pain, the only time I have a little comfort is when I am laying down.  The doctor said he has seen a case of diabetes and possible Multiple Sclerosis.   Any help would be greatly appreciated.  I was an active adult who worked out regularly and I have an 8 year old boy who I want to resume full activities with.  The only other things that I can tell are:  I had JRA when I was around ten, had left arthroscopic knee surgery at 15 and right carpal tunnel surgery at 16. I had a motorcycle accident at around 25 and broke my left clavicle, separated my shoulder and possibly tore the head of my shoulder.
title: NUMBNESS IN LEGS AND HANDS
